g.title:
<
5. Ne2
mainLine
5. .. Qb6with an immediate threat to mate
on f2 forces white to play6. d4 e6two
options for white
>
g.text: with an immediate threat to mate
on f2 forces white to play

g.title:
<
7. Nfg1
mainLine
intention is 8. f3 so7. .. f6 8. f3 Ng5 9.
exf6 gxf6 10. f4 Ne4white challanges the
strong e4 knight12. Ng3 Bd7 13. Nxe4 dxe4 14.
c3black is more developed than white; check
on Qh5+ would be premature.14. .. c5 15. d5
to block Nc615. .. exd5 16. Qxd5Do not
overstretch to defend pawn on e416. .. Nc6 17.
Qxe4+ Ne7 17. Nf3 0-0-0black down a pawn for
development advantage. If white castles on
the king side the king will be vulnerable on
semi open g file and also on the g1-h7
diagonal.
>
g.text: black is more developed than white; check
overstretch to defend pawn on e4
development advantage. If white castles on
the king side the king will be vulnerable on
semi open g file and also on the g1-h7

g.title:
<
5. Ne2
mainLine
5. .. Qb6with an immediate threat to mate
on f2 forces white to play6. d4 e6two
options for white
>-><
7. Nfg1
mainLine
intention is 8. f3 so7. .. f6 8. f3 Ng5 9.
exf6 gxf6 10. f4 Ne4white challanges the
strong e4 knight12. Ng3 Bd7 13. Nxe4 dxe4 14.
c3black is more developed than white; check
on Qh5+ would be premature.14. .. c5 15. d5
to block Nc615. .. exd5 16. Qxd5Do not
overstretch to defend pawn on e416. .. Nc6 17.
Qxe4+ Ne7 17. Nf3 0-0-0black down a pawn for
development advantage. If white castles on
the king side the king will be vulnerable on
semi open g file and also on the g1-h7
diagonal.
>

<
7. Ng3
7. .. c5 8. Bd3to increase pressure on
knight on e48. .. Nxg3 9. hxg3 cxd4white can
recapture on d4 as bishop check wins queen
for white but after 10. Nxd4 black can 10. ..
Nc6 with good development and attack on both
the knight and e pawn. So instead10. Ng5threat
on the king side.10. .. Nc6 11. Nxh7 Bd7
possible rook sacrifice via 12. Nf6 bxf6 13.
Rxh8 0-0-0 white needs to continue with 14.
Kf1 to avoid loosing the rook on h8 and 14.
.. fxe5
>
g.text: recapture on d4 as bishop check wins queen
for white but after 10. Nxd4 black can 10. ..
Nc6 with good development and attack on both
the knight and e pawn. So instead
possible rook sacrifice via 12. Nf6 bxf6 13.
Rxh8 0-0-0 white needs to continue with 14.
Kf1 to avoid loosing the rook on h8 and 14.

g.title:
<
5. Ne2
mainLine
5. .. Qb6with an immediate threat to mate
on f2 forces white to play6. d4 e6two
options for white
>-><
7. Ng3
7. .. c5 8. Bd3to increase pressure on
knight on e48. .. Nxg3 9. hxg3 cxd4white can
recapture on d4 as bishop check wins queen
for white but after 10. Nxd4 black can 10. ..
Nc6 with good development and attack on both
the knight and e pawn. So instead10. Ng5threat
on the king side.10. .. Nc6 11. Nxh7 Bd7
possible rook sacrifice via 12. Nf6 bxf6 13.
Rxh8 0-0-0 white needs to continue with 14.
Kf1 to avoid loosing the rook on h8 and 14.
.. fxe5
>

<
The two kinghts variation
1. e4 c6 2. Nc3 d5 3. Nf3white can move
either knights first
>

<
3. .. Nf6
mainLine
move 4. d3 is a mistake: after exchange of
pawns on e4 black can exchange queens with
either castling or a pawn loss for white

move 4. exd5 gives a nice IQP for black

4. e5 Ne4No major worries about white
capturing on e4 because white pawn on e is
vulnareble and Nf3 does not have a nice
square to go to. White options:
>
g.text: move 4. d3 is a mistake: after exchange of
pawns on e4 black can exchange queens with
either castling or a pawn loss for white
move 4. exd5 gives a nice IQP for black
capturing on e4 because white pawn on e is
vulnareble and Nf3 does not have a nice
square to go to. White options:

<
3. .. Bg4
TODO
the usual caro-kann idea of moving the white
squared bishop out of the pawn chain and then
close it with e6. On 4. h3 if black 4. .. Bh5
then 5. g4 with very sharp lines or exchange
the bishop for the knight gives white the
bishop pair without much compensation

TODO research
>

<
3. .. Nf6
mainLine
move 4. d3 is a mistake: after exchange of
pawns on e4 black can exchange queens with
either castling or a pawn loss for white

move 4. exd5 gives a nice IQP for black

4. e5 Ne4No major worries about white
capturing on e4 because white pawn on e is
vulnareble and Nf3 does not have a nice
square to go to. White options:
>-><
5. Ne2
mainLine
5. .. Qb6with an immediate threat to mate
on f2 forces white to play6. d4 e6two
options for white
>

<
5. d3
5. .. Nxc3 6. bxc3the move Bg4 would
simplify play for white via h3, instead6. .. e6is
recommended7. Be2 c5 8. 0-0 Nc6 9. d4 Be7
10. Be3 b6 11. Re1 0-0
>
g.text: simplify play for white via h3, instead

g.title:
<
3. .. Nf6
mainLine
move 4. d3 is a mistake: after exchange of
pawns on e4 black can exchange queens with
either castling or a pawn loss for white

move 4. exd5 gives a nice IQP for black

4. e5 Ne4No major worries about white
capturing on e4 because white pawn on e is
vulnareble and Nf3 does not have a nice
square to go to. White options:

5. d3

recommended7. Be2 c5 8. 0-0 Nc6 9. d4 Be7

>

<
5. d4
5. .. Nxc3 6. bxc3 c5 7. c4with tension in
the center.7. .. Nc6 8. dxc5 e6to attack c5
and defend d59. cxd5 exd5white can't
really defend c5 pawn because after 10. Be3
Bxc5 11. Bxc5 Qa5+ wins the bishop back with
an extra pawn10. Bd3
>
g.text: really defend c5 pawn because after 10. Be3
Bxc5 11. Bxc5 Qa5+ wins the bishop back with

g.title:
<
3. .. Nf6
mainLine
move 4. d3 is a mistake: after exchange of
pawns on e4 black can exchange queens with
either castling or a pawn loss for white

move 4. exd5 gives a nice IQP for black

4. e5 Ne4No major worries about white
capturing on e4 because white pawn on e is
vulnareble and Nf3 does not have a nice
square to go to. White options:
>-><
5. d4
5. .. Nxc3 6. bxc3 c5 7. c4with tension in
the center.7. .. Nc6 8. dxc5 e6to attack c5
and defend d59. cxd5 exd5white can't
really defend c5 pawn because after 10. Be3
Bxc5 11. Bxc5 Qa5+ wins the bishop back with
an extra pawn10. Bd3
>
